CodeList.Name: New York Heart Association Classification

Description.TranslatedText: A terminology codelist based on the functional classification developed by the New York Heart Association (NYHA), for categorizing patients with defined or presumed cardiac disease.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: New York Heart Association Class I
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Without limitations of physical activity. Ordinary physical activity does not cause undue fatigue, palpitations, or dyspnea.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: New York Heart Association Class I

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: New York Heart Association Class II
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Slight limitation of physical activity. The patient is comfortable at rest. Ordinary physical activity results in fatigue, palpitations, or dyspnea.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: New York Heart Association Class II

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: New York Heart Association Class III
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Marked limitation of physical activity. The patient is comfortable at rest. Less than ordinary activity causes fatigue, palpitations, or dyspnea.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: New York Heart Association Class III

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: New York Heart Association Class IV
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Inability to carry on any physical activity without discomfort. Heart failure symptoms are present even at rest or with minimal exertion.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: New York Heart Association Class IV

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC SDTM New York Heart Association Class Responses Terminology
